title: Remove the check method of sharding rule
body:
Fixes #12195

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- Remove the check method of sharding rule

When I use `drop sharding table rule` to delete the last rule, the `tables` and `autoTables` in the local `ShardingSphereMetaData` will be empty, which will cause persistence failure.

When starting and modifying `sharding table rule`, local data should be persisted to ZK

- Define a sub-type of ShardingSphereAlgorithm for cluster auto switch: `ScalingClusterAutoSwitchAlgorithm`

- Replace hard-coded algorithm in `allIncrementalTasksAlmostFinished`

title: Fix 12046 : Scaling incremental task status never finished
body:
Fixes #12046.

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- Remove workflowConfig in `FinishedCheckJob`, since it's not needed any more
- Rename delayMilliseconds to latestActiveTimeMillis, since PG test_decoding plugin won't generate commit time, we'll use unitified active time
- Add importer listener to update `latestActiveTimeMillis` when incremental task import a batch of records successfully
- Fix updated progress overwritten
- Check `allIncrementalTasksAlmostFinished` by idle time

- Modify the schema judgment condition in BroadcastDatabaseBackendHandler.class
- Modify unit test

In the current situation, `BroadcastDatabaseBackendHandler.java` and `UnicastDatabaseBackendHandler.java` can be executed without `Rules`
